Re: License #: CI740201466
Dear Jolyne Baarck:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
03/20/2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Thomasc7@michigan.gov

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility was not in need of any technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility was not offered consultation.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
An overview of financial records, including the annual report, was completed. No
concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review. The
agency was found to be in substantial compliance during the last audit and as a
result no follow up on CAP was indicated. Unplanned discharges were noted to be
a result of the youth no longer desiring to remain in the voluntary placement. No
areas of concern were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Three staff members were interviewed during the interim inspection. No issues or
concerns were reported. One youth was interviewed at the facility. No concerns
were noted, and the youth reported transitioning well in the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through was completed at the facility. The agency was found to be well
maintained and properly staffed. No areas of concerns were noted.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
March 22, 2023
____________________________________________________________
Cassandra Thomas Date
